chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
is_true (valid init_dstate2)

Premises:
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Notation valid := @PCM.valid
init_dstate2 = sv \\-> init_loc \+ sd \\-> init_loc : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC nat_ordType heapUMC)
validUn : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U), validUn_spec (U:=U) f1 f2 (valid (f1 \+ f2))
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { valid_op : T -> bool; join_op : T -> T -> T; unit_op : T; _ : commutative join_op; _ : associative join_op; _ : left_id unit_op join_op; _ : forall x y : T, valid_op (join_op x y) -> valid_op x; _ : is_true (valid_op unit_op) } Arguments PCM.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments PCM.Mixin [T]%type_scope [valid_op join_op]%function_scope [unit_op] _ _ _ _%function_scope
heap_pts : forall A : Type, ptr -> A -> heapUMC
updPtUnO : forall (A1 A2 : Type) (x : ptr_ordType) (i : heap) (v1 : A1) (v2 : A2) (f : forall k : heap, partition k i), upd (cT:=heapUMC) x (axioms.dyn id v2) (f (x :-> v1)) = f (x :-> v2)
null = ptr_nat 0 : ptr
heapPCMMix = union_map_classPCMMix heapUMC : PCM.mixin_of heapUMC
ssr_have : forall Plemma Pgoal : Type, Plemma -> (Plemma -> Pgoal) -> Pgoal
Variant phant (p : Type) : Prop := Phant : phant p Arguments phant _%type_scope Arguments Phant _%type_scope
domU : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (v : V) (f : U), dom (cT:=U) (upd (cT:=U) k v f) =i [pred x | cond U k & if x == k then valid f else x \in dom (cT:=U) f]
UMC.empb_op : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (p : pred K) (T : Type), UMC.mixin_of (K:=K) V p T -> T -> bool
freePtUnO : forall (A : Type) (h : heap) (x : ptr) (v : A) (f : partition (x :-> v) h), valid f -> free (cT:=heapUMC) x f = h
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : Ordered.class_of sort } Arguments Ordered.Pack [sort]%type_scope
unitL : forall (U : pcm) (x : U), Unit \+ x = x
is_true_true = erefl true : true
umUPtE : forall (K : ordType) (V : eqType) (k : K) (v : V) (f : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC K V)), (f \+ k \\-> v == Unit) = false
cancel2 : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k1 k2 : K) (f1 f2 : U) (v1 v2 : V), valid (pts k1 v1 \+ f1) -> pts k1 v1 \+ f1 = pts k2 v2 \+ f2 -> if k1 == k2 then v1 = v2 /\ f1 = f2 else [/\ free (cT:=U) k1 f2 = free (cT:=U) k2 f1, f1 = pts k2 v2 \+ free (cT:=U) k1 f2 & f2 = pts k1 v1 \+ free (cT:=U) k2 f1]
SeqLib.remove_elem = fix remove_elem (xs : seq (nat * nat * Exports.input)) (e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType)) {struct xs} : seq (nat * nat * Exports.input) := match xs with | [::] => [::] | x :: xs0 => if x == e then xs0 else x :: remove_elem xs0 e end : seq (nat * nat * Exports.input) -> prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType) -> seq (nat * nat * Exports.input) Arguments SeqLib.remove_elem _%seq_scope
Actions.safe_safe : forall (W : world) (p : protocol) (this : nid) (l : Label) (st : send_trans (nodes:=Protocols.nodes p) (coh p)) (msg : Exports.input) (to : nid) (s : state), Actions.send_act_safe W (p:=p) this l st msg to s -> send_safe st this to (getStatelet s l) msg
PCM.pack : forall T : Type, PCM.mixin_of T -> pcm
pick = fun h : heap => match h with | Heap.Undef => null | @Heap.Def hs _ => head null (supp hs) end : heap -> ptr
Heap.empty = Heap.Def (finmap:=nil ptr_ordType (axioms.dynamic id)) is_true_true : heap
hcancelPtV2 : forall (A : Type) (x1 x2 : ptr) (v1 v2 : A), valid (x1 :-> v1) -> x1 : -> v1 = x2 : -> v2 -> (x1, v1) = (x2, v2)
UMC.class : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (cT : union_map_class K V), UMC.class_of K V cT
ProtocolWithInvariant.R_inv : forall p : protocol, (dstatelet -> pred nid -> Prop) -> receive_trans (nodes:=Protocols.nodes p) (coh p) -> Prop
PCM.sort = fun t : pcm => let (sort, _) := t in sort : pcm -> Type PCM.sort is a coercion
getStatelet = fun (s : state) (i : Label) => match find (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) i s with | Some d => d | None => empty_dstatelet end : state -> Label -> dstatelet
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : PCM.mixin_of sort } Arguments PCM.Pack [sort]%type_scope
axioms.dyn : forall (interp : ?C -> Type) (A : ?C), interp A -> {x : ?C & interp x} where ?C : [ |- Type]
union_mapPCMMix : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), PCM.mixin_of (union_mapUMC K V)
cohDom : forall (nodes : dstatelet -> pred nid) (coh : cohpred nodes) (d : dstatelet), d \In coh -> dom (cT:=union_mapUMC [ordType of nid] heap) (dstate d) =i nodes d

```coq
apply ssr_have with (Plemma:=True) (Pgoal:=is_true (valid init_dstate2)).
- apply Phant.
- intro _.
  apply is_true_true.
  simpl.
  rewrite /init_dstate2 /valid /=.
  apply validUn.
Qed.
```

original: apply ssr_have with (Plemma:=True) (Pgoal:=is_true (valid init_dstate2)). - apply Phant. -
